  • Field Details

    • MazeMap

      public MazeCell[][] MazeMap

    • Height

      public final int Height

    • Width

      public final int Width

  • Constructor Details

    • Maze

      public Maze(int Height, int Width) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates a maze of Height × Width, within 10 and 100. This will auto populate the maze with cells.
      Parameters:
      Height - Integer in the bounds of 10 <= Height <= 100
      Width - Integer in the bounds of 10 <= Width <= 100
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • Maze

      public Maze(int Height, int Width, String CellBytes)
      Generates a maze of Height × Width, within 10 and 100. This maze is updated to match the data in CellBytes
      Parameters:
      Height - Integer in the bounds of 10 <= Height <= 100
      Width - Integer in the bounds of 10 <= Width <= 100
      CellBytes - A string representative of the Maze. Refer to MazeCell.CurrentCellWalls for the layout of bits per cell

  • Method Details

    • GetCellString

      public String GetCellString()
      Returns:
      A string of bits. 5 bits refers to 1 cell. Refer to MazeCell.CurrentCellWalls for the layout of bits per cell

    • PopulateMap

      private void PopulateMap()
      Is used to populate the maze map with cells

    • GeneratedMaze

      public void GeneratedMaze()
      Generates a Maze from the current map by using Recursive Backtracking This function will reset the maze prior to generation

    • Inbounds

      public boolean Inbounds(int x, int y)
      Parameters:
      x - An Int referring to the position being tested
      y - An Int referring to the position being tested
      Returns:
      True if the provided X and Y positions are within the bounds of the current maze

    • FindSolution

      public AStNode FindSolution()
      Provides an internal wrapper for AstarSolver.FindPath(AStNode, AStNode) that predefines the start and end goals as the upper left and lower right cells.
      Returns:
      returns the result of AstarSolver.FindPath(AStNode, AStNode)
